thread.title: George scores 17 as Pacers defeat Cavaliers 107-85
thread.title_full: George scores 17 as Pacers defeat Cavaliers 107-85

title: George scores 17 as Pacers defeat Cavaliers 107-85
text:
George scores 17 as Pacers defeat Cavaliers 107-85 AP 
Oct 15, 2015 at 9:52p ET + Updated Oct 15, 2015 at 9:52p ET 
CLEVELAND (AP) Paul George scored 17 points and the Indiana Pacers kept the Cleveland Cavaliers winless in the preseason with a 107-85 victory on Thursday night. 
Cleveland (0-5) played without LeBron James , who sat out for the second straight game. Coach David Blatt said James might not play for the remainder of the preseason as the team tries to limit the four-time MVP's minutes going into the Oct. 27 opener at Chicago. 
PACERS: Ian Mahinmi had 16 points and seven rebounds. ... Monta Ellis , a key offseason pickup, added 14 points. ... Rookie Myles Turner scored 11 points off the bench. 
CAVALIERS: Timofey Mozgov led Cleveland with 16 points. ... J.R. Smith scored 10 points after missing three games with a strained hamstring. ... Matthew Dellavedova didn't play because of a sore ankle. 
STAR WATCH: Kevin Love , who dislocated his left shoulder in the first round of last season's playoffs, could return Sunday in Toronto. 
KEEP ME IN, COACH: Pacers coach Frank Vogel said George has been full-go throughout training camp after missing most of last season with a broken leg. ''I've given him opportunities to take time off and his response is, `I kind of had the whole year off last year. I like being in there,''' Vogel said. 
UP NEXT: Indiana visits Chicago on Tuesday. Cleveland plays at Toronto on Sunday.
